p: The reduction in melatonin production, as in elderly people or those with chronic metabolic diseases, induces insulin resistance, glucose intolerance, sleep disturbance, and metabolic circadian disorganization characterizing a state of chronodisruption leading to obesity ( Cipolla-Neto et al., 2014). These findings indicate that melatonin complementary therapy can play a vital role in reestablishing a more healthy condition of individuals with chronic metabolic diseases.
